intro: Rhexia elachistophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bluetail, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in pine forests and shaded wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, which helps it conserve moisture in its natural habitat. Rhexia elachistophylla plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
